trans-unit.source: Register for Microsoft authentication | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Register for Microsoft authentication | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to register for Microsoft authentication in your Azure Mobile Services application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to register for Microsoft authentication in your Azure Mobile Services application.

trans-unit.source: Register your app to use Microsoft account for authentication
trans-unit.target: Register your app to use Microsoft account for authentication

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to register your mobile app to be able to use Microsoft account as an identity provider with Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to register your mobile app to be able to use Microsoft account as an identity provider with Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: The same steps apply for both service-directed authentication and client-directed authentication using the Live SDK.
trans-unit.target: The same steps apply for both service-directed authentication and client-directed authentication using the Live SDK.

trans-unit.source: Register your Windows Store app at the Windows Dev Center
trans-unit.target: Register your Windows Store app at the Windows Dev Center

trans-unit.source: Windows Store apps must first be registered with the Windows Dev Center.
trans-unit.target: Windows Store apps must first be registered with the Windows Dev Center.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]Windows Phone 8, Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight, and non-Windows apps can skip this section.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]Windows Phone 8, Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight, and non-Windows apps can skip this section.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the [Windows Dev Center](https://dev.windows.com/dashboard/Application/New), log on with your Microsoft account, type a name for your app, then click **Reserve app name**.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the [Windows Dev Center](https://dev.windows.com/dashboard/Application/New), log on with your Microsoft account, type a name for your app, then click **Reserve app name**.

trans-unit.source: Open your Windows app project in Visual Studio, then in Solution Explorer right-click the Windows Store app project, click **Store** > **Associate App with the Store...**.
trans-unit.target: Open your Windows app project in Visual Studio, then in Solution Explorer right-click the Windows Store app project, click **Store** > **Associate App with the Store...**.

trans-unit.source: In the wizard, click **Sign in** and sign-in with your Microsoft account, select the app name you reserved, then click **Next** > **Associate**.
trans-unit.target: In the wizard, click **Sign in** and sign-in with your Microsoft account, select the app name you reserved, then click **Next** > **Associate**.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) For a universal Windows 8.1 app, repeat steps 4 and 5 for the Windows Phone Store project.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) For a universal Windows 8.1 app, repeat steps 4 and 5 for the Windows Phone Store project.

trans-unit.source: Back in the Windows Dev Center page for your new app, click **Services** > **Push notifications**.
trans-unit.target: Back in the Windows Dev Center page for your new app, click **Services** > **Push notifications**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Push notifications** page, click **Live Services site** under **Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) and Microsoft Azure Mobile Services**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Push notifications** page, click **Live Services site** under **Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) and Microsoft Azure Mobile Services**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Microsoft account page for your app.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Microsoft account page for your app.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will get the authentication credentials that Azure needs to use Microsoft authentication with your app.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will get the authentication credentials that Azure needs to use Microsoft authentication with your app.

trans-unit.source: Configure your Microsoft account registration and connect to Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Configure your Microsoft account registration and connect to Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: The first step in this section applies only to Windows Phone 8, Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight, and non-Windows Store apps.
trans-unit.target: The first step in this section applies only to Windows Phone 8, Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight, and non-Windows Store apps.

trans-unit.source: For these apps, you can also ignore the Package security identifier (SID), which is only available for Windows Store apps.
trans-unit.target: For these apps, you can also ignore the Package security identifier (SID), which is only available for Windows Store apps.

trans-unit.source: For a non-Windows Store app, navigate to the [My Applications](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=262039) page in the Microsoft account Developer Center, log on with your Microsoft account (if required), click **Create application**, type an **Application name**, then click **I accept**.
trans-unit.target: For a non-Windows Store app, navigate to the [My Applications](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=262039) page in the Microsoft account Developer Center, log on with your Microsoft account (if required), click **Create application**, type an **Application name**, then click **I accept**.

trans-unit.source: This reserves you app name with Microsoft account and displays the Microsoft account page for your app.
trans-unit.target: This reserves you app name with Microsoft account and displays the Microsoft account page for your app.

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft account page for your app, click **API Settings**, enable **Mobile or desktop client app**, set the mobile service URL as the **Target domain**, then supply one of the following URL formats in **Redirect URL** and click **Save**:
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft account page for your app, click **API Settings**, enable **Mobile or desktop client app**, set the mobile service URL as the **Target domain**, then supply one of the following URL formats in **Redirect URL** and click **Save**:

trans-unit.source: **.NET backend**: `https://<mobile_service>.azure-mobile.net/signin-microsoft`
trans-unit.target: **.NET backend**: `https://<mobile_service>.azure-mobile.net/signin-microsoft`

trans-unit.source: **JavaScript backend**: `https://<mobile_service>.azure-mobile.net/login/microsoftaccount`
trans-unit.target: **JavaScript backend**: `https://<mobile_service>.azure-mobile.net/login/microsoftaccount`

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]Make sure that you use the correct redirect URL path format for your type of Mobile Services backend.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]Make sure that you use the correct redirect URL path format for your type of Mobile Services backend.

trans-unit.source: When this is incorrect, authentication will not succeed.
trans-unit.target: When this is incorrect, authentication will not succeed.

trans-unit.source: The **Root domain** should fill in automatically.
trans-unit.target: The **Root domain** should fill in automatically.

trans-unit.source: ![Microsoft account API settings](./media/mobile-services-how-to-register-microsoft-authentication/mobile-services-win8-app-push-auth-2.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Microsoft account API settings](./media/mobile-services-how-to-register-microsoft-authentication/mobile-services-win8-app-push-auth-2.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **App Settings** and make a note of the values of the **Client ID**, **Client secret** and **Package SID**.
trans-unit.target: Click **App Settings** and make a note of the values of the **Client ID**, **Client secret** and **Package SID**.

trans-unit.source: ![Microsoft account app settings](./media/mobile-services-how-to-register-microsoft-authentication/mobile-services-win8-app-push-auth.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Microsoft account app settings](./media/mobile-services-how-to-register-microsoft-authentication/mobile-services-win8-app-push-auth.png)

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure classic portal], click the **Identity** tab for the mobile service, enter the client ID, client secret and package SID obtained from your identity provider, then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure classic portal], click the **Identity** tab for the mobile service, enter the client ID, client secret and package SID obtained from your identity provider, then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]You do not need to supply a Package SID value for a Windows Phone 8, Windows Phone Store 8.1 Silverlight, or a non-Windows app.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]You do not need to supply a Package SID value for a Windows Phone 8, Windows Phone Store 8.1 Silverlight, or a non-Windows app.

trans-unit.source: Both your mobile service and your app are now configured to work with Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: Both your mobile service and your app are now configured to work with Microsoft account.
